question: Which of the following were the participants of the famous "Black Power Salute" in the 1968 Summer Olympics, Mexico City?
option1: Tommie Smith, John Carlos, Peter Norman
option2: Jesse Owens, Michael Jordan, Carl Lewis
option3: Jackie Robinson, Jim Brown, Bill Russell
option4: Willie Mays, Hank Aaron, Wilt Chamberlain
answer: Tommie Smith, John Carlos, Peter Norman
explanation: Tommie Smith, John Carlos, Peter Norman were the participants of the famous "Black Power Salute" in the 1968 Summer Olympics, Mexico City. During their medal ceremony in the Olympic Stadium in Mexico City on October 16, 1968, two African-American athletes, Tommie Smith and John Carlos, each raised a black-gloved fist during the playing of the US national anthem. While on the podium, Smith and Carlos, who had won gold and bronze medals respectively in the 200-meter running event of the 1968 Summer Olympics, turned to face the US flag and then kept their hands raised until the anthem had finished. In addition, Smith, Carlos, and Australian silver medalist Peter Norman all wore human rights badges on their jackets.
